item.description:
Meet in the visitor center parking lot at 10:30   http://www.fws.gov/northeast/assabetriver/PDF/May07MapHandout.pdf

Assabet River National Wildlife Refuge The refuge, part of the National Wildlife Refuge System, encompasses 3.5 square miles located within the towns of Hudson , Maynard, Stow and Sudbury . Dogs are not allowed. The refuge comprises over 2,200 acres of varied woodland, wetland, fields, ponds and streams, with historical and archeological sites. The terrain is primarily flat but includes some prominent hills; elevations range from 170 feet near the river to 320 feet on Walnut Hill. Seventy percent of the refuge is forested with pine, oak and maple. There are over 470 acres of diverse wetland habitat including an Atlantic white cedar swamp. This jewel is connected to about 1,000 acres of other diverse protected space.

From the east, to get to the main entrance: Take Rte 27 to Sudbury Center then take a left to head west on Hudson Road for about 1 and a half miles. 

Lunch afterwards at the Blue Coyote Grille, 137 Main St, Maynard.
item.name: Assabet River National Wildlife Refuge
